Vanilla Cheating...?

...please stop misleading others from understanding netorare and netori. Netorare is a passive verb in jp, and in this doujin culture it means the mc's spouse/family/crush gets taken over sexually by another. Netori is an active verb, it means the mc does the sexual takeover and doesn't have anything to do with being forceful or kind. A simple google search will net you this tbh. Also there's a guy documenting NTR culture in a substantial depth in a forum.

TL'DR:  get educated.

Cheating and the various types of NTR are different things. Especially justified cheating. NTR usually involves force and it's not so much about getting the partner being stolen, but hurting the person being stolen from.
wasnt netori when the MC steals the girl and not the other way around?
Netori is when the guy gets taken from the girl Neterore is when the girl gets taken from the guy

Its Netori actually. Thats when you steal some one from another in a more positive way with not really any messed up feelings. Like stealing a great girl from an asshole (case in point this story). I always thought it should be a New tag here already to separate the positive NTR with the original and more negative version.
